data.name: Steganography Part 2
data.description:
## Steganography Part 2

- Part 1 - https://www.codewars.com/kata/624fc787983b3500648faf11

Steganography is the practice of concealing a message within another medium. In Part 1, we concealed a message into pixels. In this case, we have `pixels` that already have a message concealed in them and we want to extract the message back out.

Your function will take the 2D array `pixels` and reconstruct the message using each pixel color's Least Significant Bit, returning the message.

#### Notes
1. You can assume that the `pixels` inner array always has a length of 3 (for Red, Green, Blue).
2. Since bytes are 8 bits long and `pixels` are in groups of 3, every 3rd pixel group's last color should be skipped.

With input:
```
pixels = [
  [200,213,128],[8,71,54],[154,124,135],
  [138,175,117],[64,98,137],[142,191,5],
  [120,113,209],[20,167,193],[38,146,171],
  [88,235,147],[180,221,49],[24,186,226],
  [244,215,195],[114,19,67],[101,161,57],
]
```
An example output will look like:
```
output = "Hello"
```
